acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 2 from 96-hour LC50=0.696mg NH3/L (ammonium-chloride concentration equivalent: 2.19 mg/L) of fishes (Rainbow trout) (ECETOC TR91, 2003).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: It was set as Category 4 based on the description of LD50=1650 mg/kg in a rat (ACGIH (2002)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 2, since acute toxicity was Category 2 and behavior in water and bioaccumulative potential are unknown.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available.

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Since it gave negative in mice micronucleus test (IUCLID (2000)), we classified it as Out Of Category according to the technical guideline.

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classification not possible, though inorganic compounds containing halogen.

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale:
Although there is no statement on toxicity to the parents in mice, there is a statement that malformation was observed in their offsprings (HSDB (2005)). 
Moreover, there is a statement that ovary hypertrophy, follicular maturation, luteal formation, hypertrophy of uterus, hypertrophy of mammilla, and milk secretion were observed in non-crossed female rabbits (EHC 54 (1986)), and there is also a statement that absorbed embryos amounted to one fourth at a dose occuring metabolic acidosis in parent rats (IUCLID (2000)). Based on the above-mentioned, it was classified into Category 2.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: There is a statement that stimulates an eye by short-term exposure in humans (ICSC (J), (2000)), and that redness and a pain of the eye are caused as the primary disaster / an acute symptoms (ICSC (J), (2000)). With a rabbit, there are an evaluation with mild (ACGIH (2002), RTECS (2005)) and severe (RTECS (2005)), and a statement that although cataract, iridal bleeding, and the appearance of fibrin of the anterior chamber of eye, etc. were seen, it recovered (HSDB (2005)). It was set as Category 2A-2B based on the above information.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: It was classified as Category 3 based on the description that as effects of short-term exposure it "stimulates the skin", and as primary disaster / an acute symptoms cause "redness" on humans (ICSC (J) (2000)).

skin_sensitizer.rationale: Although there is a statement that the result of the maximization test with guinea pigs was negative(IUCLID (2000)), it was an information of Priority 2 and the only deta on hand, it was decided that it could not be classified due to the insufficiency of data..

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (systemic toxicity)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: It was classified to as Category 1 (systemic toxicity) based on the statement  that metabolic acidosis was occured in humans (ACGIH (2002)). In addition, although there is no statement of dosage, there is a description that also in a rat, a rabbit, and a dog, osteoporosis is produced by long-term administrations, and the cause is metabolic acidosis (EHC 54 (1986)).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause respiratory irritation (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: There is the description that respiratory is irritated by short-term exposure and the description that inhalation poduces coughs and pharyngeal pain (ICSC (J) (2000)), it is classified into Category 3 (respiratory irritation).
